Safe and Reasonable Precautions

Safe and reasonable precautions are actions that a reasonable person would do to reduce or eliminate the chance of injury or damage due to accidental release of a dangerous good.

These precautions include both general safety practices, as well as specific activities taken that are relevant to the prevention of an accident.

 

This could include employing safe driving habits while transporting ammunition, as well as following the policies and laws that dictate how to pack and load ammunition in a vehicle.

 

What is reasonable is not absolute perfection, however it is   a balanced, wise, prudent judgement that is understandable to others. What is "reasonable" varies with the circumstances and the risk.

The greater the risk, the greater the care that is reasonable.
